data.title: Student Health and Wellness Centre
data.meta_description: Your wellness journey starts here! To help you reach your full potential, the Student Health and Wellness Centre is exclusively open to University of Ottawa and Saint Paul University students.
data.text:
Your wellness journey starts here! To help you reach your full potential, the Student Health and Wellness Centre is exclusively open to University of Ottawa and Saint Paul University students.

Transition to the new TELUS CHR Connect app

As of June 24, the UpPatient app will be replaced by a new TELUS CHR Connect application. From that point on, when you try to connect through the UpPatient app, you will see a message asking you to download TELUS CHR Connect and create a new username and password. When you do, please use your uOttawa email address and the exact name listed on your patient file. If you have used UpPatient for online sessions, be sure to upload the new application before your next appointment to ensure you are on time.

TELUS CHR Connect application.

Services at the Student Health and Wellness Centre (SHWC)

The Centre is staffed by a multidisciplinary team of health professionals, including physicians, nurse practitioners, registered nurses, health promotion specialists, psychotherapists, psychologists and psychiatrists working together in a shared care model.

Location: Minto Sports Complex, 801 King Edward Avenue, Room N203 (2nd floor), Ottawa, Ontario K1N 6N5

Mind

Mind

Mental health

Whether it’s Counselling and Therapy, Support Groups or more, the Centre is here to support you.

Body

Body

Physical health

The SHWC offers tailored medical expertise and a safe, inclusive environment.

Learn

Learn

Health promotion at the Centre

Through learning and navigation, the Centre can empower you on your health and wellness journey.

Declaration of absence from an evaluation

If you can’t submit an assignment or complete an evaluation due to an absence from at least one of your courses, you must complete this form.

Easily book appointments at the Student Health and Wellness Centre!

Discover the uoWellness app, an innovative and transformative experience at uOttawa. Developped by students for students, this app is designed to make your wellness journey simpler and engaging.

Learn more about the app!

How to book an appointment

For physical health appointments, we release timeslots online at 8 am on the 1st and 15th of each month. Also, if you are trying to book an appointment for the same day, you can find a limited number of same-day appointments, every day at 8 am. However, there is no guarantee of appointment availability.

For mental health intake appointment, please note that you can book an appointment only four days in advance. We also reserve some same-day appointments that can be booked on a ''first come, first served'' basis.

If you need further assistance, please call the Centre directly or e-mail us at [email protected].

Find out more about current wait times, and other health care locations in Ottawa by visiting the Understanding Wait Times and the When and Where pages.

Download and launch the TELUS CHR Connect app from Google Play or Apple Store.

Search and select the " uOttawa | Centre de santé et mieux-être étudiant / Student Health and Wellness Centre"

Create your account. For more information on how to create your account, consult the CHR Connect app webpage.

For medical appointments, we release timeslots online at 8 am on the 1st and 15th of each month. Also, if you are trying to book an appointment for the same day, you can find a limited number of same-day appointments, every day at 8 am. However, there is no guarantee of appointment availability. For mental health intake appointment, please note that you can book an appointment only four days in advance. We also reserve some same-day appointments that can be booked on a ''first come, first served'' basis. If you are unable to book an appointment online, please call the Centre directly or send an email to [email protected].

Remember to always have your health card (or UHIP number if you’re an international student) and student card handy when booking and attending your appointment.

For more information regarding protection of your health information, please consult the Student Health and Wellness Centre Public Notice in accordance with the Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA).

Students enrolled with the University of Ottawa or Saint Paul University have access to all services at the Student Health and Wellness Centre (some exceptions apply). Please consult the Student Eligibility for Care Policy (PDF, 175.72 KB).

A missed appointment is:

not showing up for a scheduled appointment and not notifying the Centre, or

cancelling an appointment within 24 hours (see the “Fees” page).

For more information consult the missed appointment policy document.

If you are unable to attend your scheduled appointment, contact our Centre right away at 613-562-5498 or send an email to [email protected]. Since appointments are in high demand, your quick cancellation will give another student the opportunity to access timely care.

Your scheduled appointment time is reserved just for you. Our providers make every effort to be on time for scheduled appointments. In return, we ask that you help us by keeping your scheduled appointments and by notifying us in advance when you are unable to do so. When you give us advanced notice, we are able to accommodate other students.

Appointment Reminder:

As a courtesy, the Centre sends appointment reminders via email or text messages for all scheduled appointments. If you do not receive appointment reminders, you are still responsible for arriving on time.

Our physicians and staff members are dedicated to ensuring that you receive the medical attention you need in a respectful manner. Please remember that our zero-tolerance policy towards disrespect and inappropriate behavior is in effect at all times. We appreciate your patience in order to maintain a positive and respectful environment.

Given the high number of respiratory infections in the community and in hospital, we have temporarily reinstated the requirement to wear a mask when visiting the Health and Wellness Centre.

How to access your laboratory results

To access the results of laboratory tests done at the Student Health and Wellness Centre, follow the steps below:

Go to the Bio-Test portal.

Select the Register tab and provide your uOttawa email address.

Select Agree and Register Now. You’ll get an email with a link to create your new password.

When you create your new password, you can log in to see your test results.

Allow 24 hours (one business day) after your laboratory analysis before creating your account. This will give Bio-Test time to receive your email and add it to its database.

If you have questions, email us and someone from the centre will get back to you within two business days. For urgent inquiries, call us at 613-562-5498.

Info corner

Health education sessions

We offer Personalized Health Education Sessions to uOttawa students in order to help them navigate and explore the health and wellness services offered at uOttawa. Book an appointment with a Health Promotion Specialist.

Personalized health education program

Service offered only to uOttawa students.

Are you a student curious about the health and wellness resources available to you at uOttawa? Learn how to navigate your health and wellness with a Health Promotion Specialist. During your appointment, you will be provided with personalized education and resources regarding your health and wellness. The Health Promotion Specialist will work with you and your health care provider to determine the best care plan and support you through navigating health and wellness resources. In addition to health care provider referrals and reception referrals, this program is also self-referral!

Mission

The Student Health and Wellness Centre provides integrated physical and mental health services for students as part of broader University efforts to make quick access to health care a priority. It is guided by our seven pillars of wellness and the principles of the Okanagan Charter.

The Centre:

Provides health-care services in both official languages through a multidisciplinary team working together and sharing a space, processes and policies.

Creates a safe environment where you can connect with peer educators, learn and receive care.

Enriches your learning experience by creating and offering internship and training opportunities.

Do not hesitate to send us your questions, comments and feedback. See our contact information below.

Meet the team

Whether at the Student Health and Wellness Centre, the Wellness Lounge or the Health and Wellness Office, the professionals that form your circle of care are here for you. Meet the individuals who are passionate about supporting you in your health and wellness journey!
